column4: you can use youtube with html5, also gnash works pretty well (for me) with YouTube
will i need any additional fiddling with software for the use of html5 on youtube?
no, just a modern browser then go to http://www.youtube.com/html5
not everything is html5 yet :(  thus, gnash can pickup the rest :)
i use ff 3.6.18 (i am on ubunut 10.04) do you know at chance if chromium is modern enough?
chromium-browser should work yes
ok, will go for that one :)
i'm affraid FSF doesn't consider chromium "free" however
hm, so it's opensource but not free?
ya, PARTS of it are questionable i guess?  Debian considers it free.
honestly though, if you are concerned about software freedom, Ubuntu isn't the right distro to be using.
i know... but i try to do it within my capabilites... and in that case ubunut is fair enough for me

so i an willing to choose a opensource or even free software over a prop. one, but i am a user too. so usually if a problem occurs i try to solve it for two days or so, then see if i could adjust and as last resort fall back to prop.
i looked at the youtube html5 link ... i had to click the button "join html5 test" ... how do they identify me? i hope not my ip, becuase this would affect my flate mates too...
i'm sure it's a cookie
hm... i use chromium, but it prompts me to download flash, even after i opted in for html5 :(
just cheked... its by cookie
try a different video (as i said not everything is html5 yet), adding gnash with html5 will probably give you better results, then it will use html5 when it can, and gnash when it can't
http://html5test.com/ chromium on ubuntu 10.04 scores 313 and 13 bonus points
firefox 3.6.18 gets 179 and 4 bonus points
c-b 13 scored 312+13, and I-W scored 288+9 for me
midori gets 222+9
